website_summaries.verdict: Rigid and supportive, this large sleeping cot is the best and most comfortable available.
pros: The largest sleeping area (80 x 40 inches) of all our contenders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: At 6'7" I needed something that would fit and was comfortable. This fit the bill perfectly. Very comfortable. Very sturdy. And the tent that's available to purchase and add to it makes for a comfortable roomy sleeping place.
customer_reviews.author: BowHunter60

customer_reviews.title: Updated: SO DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.text: SO DISAPPOINTED! BENT IT THE FIRST NIGHT AND RIVETS FELL OUT. WOULD HAVE RETURNED IT BUT IT WAS PAST THE 30DAY RETURN PERIOD. Update: Reported the problem to Teton Sports. They shipped the part in less than a week; no charge. Disappointed with the issue, but happy with their response.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cot. Sleep better then at home!  Highest quality!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough about the comfort of these cots. Especially for a person my husbands size. 400+. The setup is a snap once you learn to use the little red pin attached to the cot. Optional pad is a must! I also got the organizer as well. Judge is still out of that... The downside is the cot is very large but hey that's why your buying the xxl model right? I just upgraded my tent to fit the extra width. If you want a cot that will have you sleeping like you are at home, or better, pick yourself up one of these cots. Trust me!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia MTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: IT REALLY CAN HOLD MY WEIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy (300 lbs), so it's hard to find a camping cot that doesn't sag or rip under my weight. Many claim they don't, but I've broken many a cot because of my weight. I decided to try this one out, and I was surprised. Not only did it support my weight, but it's so comfortable to sleep on! I've been using it for camping several times and it's easy to set up and fold back up and put away. I'm so glad I purchased this. If this cot holds my weight, it will definitely hold yours!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Mouzone

customer_reviews.title: Comfy for a big guy
customer_reviews.text: I set it up the day it arrived and slept on it in my livingroom that night. I am packing some weight and that xxl cot held me just fine. I learned real fast that there is a certain way to set the cot up. There is a small metal guide on the left top corner that is used to guide the crossbar into place locking the cot into place. The canvas is extremely taught once setup. I fought and fought with clearance issues until I found that little metal bar guide. This bed has become a permenant part of my camping gear. Im too old and broken to try sleeping on the ground anymore.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: 3rd shipment replacement and all have had tons of rust and damage
customer_reviews.text: The design, functionality and comfort are awesome. The manufacture customer service is awesome. What isn't awesome is the quality of the finish that over 9 cots that I have received and shipped back, ALL of them had this paint chipping and significant rust throughout the frame. For spending $120/unit, I expect top quality product and material. I suppose I will need to look around again for another product. I have informed Amazon of this issue and hopefully they will determine the cause of failure and fix it. Other than that I highly recommend this cot.
customer_reviews.author: Steve CA

customer_reviews.title: We tried to put this together and between me and ...
customer_reviews.text: We tried to put this together and between me and my 13 year old big boy scout could barley get the last pole in , the instructions say it is hard to get the last pole in and had a technique on how to do it. but we tried for 30 min and finally got it in but if you pick it up to move it the pole pops out and you start over. We camp alot and it is just to hard to set up. We are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: AnastasiaAwesome

customer_reviews.title: get serious...get comfortable
customer_reviews.text: throw out those air mattress,,guests will sleep better on this with a 6 inch thick piece of foam ( 25$)...camping...same thing...backpacking..NO WAY unless you are Paul Bunyan and have a big blue friend..heavy...sturdy....I.made camp with the Eskimo Fat Fish, teton cot,foam,bag, pillow, stove and a thunderbucket. hunted for two weeks. Never once did I think I was uncomfortable, not once. As a matter of fact, with my little transistor radio I looked forward to my hot bucket bath and then going to bed. I have a teton double -35 degree bag. Like I said, uncomfortable...not once in two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jefff

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Canvas
customer_reviews.text: At first glance this is a very well constructed cot. It is very large and comfortable and extremely easy to setup, I was initially VERY happy with the purchase. Then I went to turn over....and the canvas split. I am not a small man by any means but I am well under the 600lb weight limit. If you are a bigger guy think twice and go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the family campout
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy that this cot is lightweight enough for me to carry around and karge enough to fit my tall broadshouldered husband. It was great this last camp out as my family of 4 could all sit on it when we were playing games in the tent, the kids enjoyed "playing the drums" and entertained themselves for a while, plus my infant and i could both easily fit for feeding time. I love that we could fit several bins of gear underneath and it didnt affect confort. My husbands only complaint is that he wishes it were a bit more taught, but its heavy duty and significantly more comfortable than an air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: H and H HONEY

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Design causes bruising and scrapes
customer_reviews.text: Whoever thought it was a Great idea to have the cot rails stick out like this should be punished. THere is absolutely no way to avoid bumping into one of the 4 ends that stick out and bruising/injuring yourself. The height hits right above the knee for me about 20” high. On the ends of the long metal rods are these cheap black plastic pieces that are meant to cover the metal, but don’t stay on and so you’re exposed to sharp metal when they fall off. This design is horrible. EVERYONE in my camping party has gotten injured — thigh/leg bruising and scrapes from these cots :(
customer_reviews.author: Mieddiem

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cot based on its weight limit and width. Im a bigger guy. And sleeping on a normal cot or sleeping pad doesnt allow any room for movement. This cot is more like a twin xl. Plenty if room to sleep comfortable. I used for three nights in a row while my parents stayed with us. I almost prefer this cot over my bed. I think as a guest bed, and the few camping trips a year, i found my new favorite sleeping spot. Interested in getting the tent that fits it along with the pad.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy62

customer_reviews.title: Fork out the dough for the mattress pad...this is not comfy alone.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and get the pad made to go with this cot. I’m on night 10 in a row sleeping on this and my body HURTS. I should have gotten the pad but didn’t want to spend another chunk of money. Now I wish I had. The XXL cot is huge...be sure you know where you’re setting it up and storing it for sure. Don’t use this as a guest bed without added comfort...my back and shoulders may never be the same. Happy to be off the ground. Sad I didn’t spend the extra $.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderings

customer_reviews.title: Oy vey. Took all of my patience to completely assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Like: 1) width 2) assembly relatively easy until the last part. The dreaded bar with the tiny red bar attached to it. Dislike: 1) Getting the last bar to lock into place. Extremely difficult even with little red bar to help guide the bracket into place. 2) Even with that last bar fit into place, it is easy to pop it up and out of its "locked" position. Maybe after some practice and multiply setting up and breaking it down, thing would become easier. Not for someone who is physically challenged or in a weakened state.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Thomson

customer_reviews.title: its a big bed for big men
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge. About the size of a twin size bed mattress. The difference between the standard and limited edition is a small red clip at the end that helps to stretch the material so you can get the last bed post into place easier. It's really big, so if your looking for something to pack on the trail its probably not the product you are looking for. I used it at our base camp last hunting season and it was perfect. I'm a heavy guy (5-10, 240lbs) and it held up well for me. Also works for a guest bed if you needed one when your good for nothing brother in-law shows up.
customer_reviews.author: sparky1

customer_reviews.title: Huge cot for full-size adults
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge, in a good way, the same size as a twin bed! It has the right amount of tension to prevent sagging, with enough "give" for comfort. We did not use a pad, but that would make this even better. It is easy to assemble, and easy to set up. It folds into a relatively small bag for transport. This gets used at "Deer Camp" and it's the perfect solution - elevated off the floor, as comfortable as a cot can be, and easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.B.N.

customer_reviews.title: Did not stand up to 2 nights use without bending.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for a cabin trip, said the weight limit was well over my own weight so I figured it would be sturdy and high quality for the price. After the second night the middle legs began to bend noticably so I stopped using it. I could splint the section with a couple steel bars, but I shouldn't have to, it was supposed to be rated for heavier people than myself. Before it began to fail I was very positive on it for to it's size and comfort (with the matching Teton camping pad). But there's no way I can recommend it with it just giving in after two nights
customer_reviews.author: Gilder

customer_reviews.title: Bought NEW received USED
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars but I bought this brand new and it looked used when I got it also I’m unsure how well the top framing is going to hold up. For some reason I can’t add my photos but it came in a Teton box but when I removed it and set it up the bars are scratched up the pivot arm is scraped there is a stain on the canvas and some scratches on the frame work. Over all I needed it and it is good quality just wish that I had received a new product that was not damaged since I paid for one.
customer_reviews.author: Stephani

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and feels sturdy - and I'm a big guy
customer_reviews.text: This is fast to set up, comfortable and feels sturdy - and I'm a big guy. IMO faster and easier to set up than an air mattress and nice to be off the ground. We could put our bags and trunks under it with no problem, which really opened up our tent and made the interior experience really nice.
customer_reviews.author: M. WUNDERLICH

customer_reviews.title: Grandparent adventures
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for visiting our grandbabies, hotel costs were adding up and the kids didn't have an extra bed. We use a cot pad, mattress pad and xl twin sheets (they don't quite fit but they work fine). Obviously not using it for camping toting all of that with us, lol but those grandbabies are so worth it. We took them to visit family at Christmas due to no extra bed so we are getting a lot of use out of them. We are loving these, sleep well on them and leave no trace behind except lots of memories.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's lightweight and very easy to set up/take down
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! It's lightweight and very easy to set up/take down. Its high off the ground so it keeps him from getting congested and is big and wide so he's free to lay on his side and stretch out. He's a big guy but when he lays on it, theres still 6 inches or so between the middle rail and the fabric. One of his biggest concerns with a cot was feeling like you were laying on a middle bar. This is not the case with this cot and he's very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla E

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to orientate the cross arms correctly.
customer_reviews.text: As a 6ft 280 guy, I've always been weary about useing a cot due to lack of sturdiness. Not the case with this bad boy! In fact I was able to put a twin matress on it and it fit perfectly, and the cot handle the additional weight with no sign of steain. The first time I set it up it took me a minute ti figure out the swivel arm, but evevtually got it. I'm itching to try it in my 6 person tent on a glamping trip.
customer_reviews.author: mrA66

customer_reviews.title: Teton Sports absolute best camping cot/bed
customer_reviews.text: I've been camping over 40 years and slept on everything from foam pads to air beds, mattresses in motor homes, trailers, 5th wheels etc.. Hands down the the sleep I've ever had is on the Teton Sports Outfitter XXL folding cot for camping. I highly recommend adding the Teton Sports Foam Sleeping Pad or similar foam pad with the cot for the best sleeping experience. I use an 8 person instant family tent which has plenty of room for 2 Teton Sports XXL Outfitter Cots and other camping supplies. Everything to go camping fits in my Prius. I can go camping anywhere, anytime...in total comfort and get a great nights sleep. Thank You Teton Sports!
customer_reviews.author: paul bruemmer

customer_reviews.title: TETON FOR THE WIN!
customer_reviews.text: Best cot on the market and Teton stands behind their product! These can be difficult to set up by yourself, you need to attach one end and then wedge your foot against the leg of the cot and pull pretty hard to get the last end in the cot but once it is put together, it is VERY solid. If you need to pick it up to move it, grab it by the sides or you'll be struggling to put the end piece back on again! This is the only full sized cot I would recommend. The pad and the extra attachments for the side/underside of the cot makes for great storage.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: not a good design.
customer_reviews.text: cant get the last, (any) edge of the solo bars to reach the peg. i need alot of force and a crowbar to lever it over to the peg and then a hammer to bang into the slot. not a good design.
customer_reviews.author: jeven m.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for a good nights sleep.
customer_reviews.text: This cot is great! Paired with the Teton XXL sleeping pad this gave the best night of camping I’ve had in a long time. A downside is the weight- only sutible for car camping, but it’s worth carrying down a short trail. The fabric is very taught so getting the end bars on the first few times was really hard. It loosens up a (very) little, but if it was easier the cot would sag and it wouldn’t be as comfortable so it’s worth the extra effort.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Megatron

customer_reviews.title: Great cot if you have the room
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to use when he goes on overnight fishing trips with his friends. They all have caps on their trucks and set up cots in the back of their truck beds. This item was about five inches too long to fit in the bed of the truck with the tailgate closed so for his purpose it didn't work, but that's nothing against the quality of this item. Oh, and definitely buy the option with the pin! Putting this together without it would be almost impossible! We can't attest to the quality of sleep since he never used it. Sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne K

customer_reviews.title: I really love this cot!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this cot,...I also bought the cushy pad to match this. I slept so good, better than I do at home. My only issue is, at 67 yrs old, and hands that don't work like they used to.. I cant set this up by my self... that being said, my son in law struggled with it also. Took 2 practices runs at home setting it up before he figured out how it goes exactly.. directions weren't that detailed. Once we got past that, and actually got to camp site, it went up easy enough,. I love it, would recommend it, just practice getting it up before you go camping.
customer_reviews.author: chocolatejunkiei

customer_reviews.title: Sags to an uncomfortable depth
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this cot in 2016 it was perfect. Wide, sturdy, but difficult to attach the forth connection. Fast forward three years later and the fabric has stretched so much under my weight it is nolonger comfortable to sleep. I have used to cot 30 days in a row a few times over the past 3 years and here and there other times. As far as sleeping goes, I can not use it for that purpose anymore. It's just too uncomfortable. However, it works perfectly fine for temporarily get items off the ground until I am able to find a more permanent place to them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Huge and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cot and I am knocking a star off since the weld quality has slipped and the new style tote bag is useless. Other than that the best option on the market that I am aware of if you sleep on your side and turn during the night. If you are used to sleeping on the ground it is imperative to use a pad with any cot since cold air circulates under you. It doesn't take much and can be as simple as carpet padding. Mind the size if you are using these in a tent or drive a small vehicle. They take up a lot of room open or closed.
customer_reviews.author: William Angel

customer_reviews.title: it was an easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Ive now have used it on 2 hunting trips....lol it is on the large size for my tent but....it was an easy set up,seemed good and sturdy,had the right height for me to stuff my gear under it and out the way,and was comfortable to sleep in,and im 6ft @ 200lbs...so thats 7day on 1hunt,and10 day on 2hunt,and used for weekend when buddy used...good product/recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gjordan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cot, comfortable to lay on.
customer_reviews.text: Upfront : I ended up returning this so I didn’t really put it thru it’s paces. I returned it because I ended up not going to the event I purchased it for. But for a few days after I got it, I set it up and laid on it. Was sturdy and comfortable in that there was room to shift around. It is a two-person job setting it up. At least for a novice like me. And you need some strength too. I think if I had kept it, I would have been happy with it. I will say the return was super simple.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Best cot we've found
customer_reviews.text: This cot is great. Well worth the cost. Used nightly on a 50 day road trip with no issues, no visible wear. Very comfortable. Added a 2" foam pad as my wife is recovering from 2 operations. She has now been using it back at home rather than her regular bed. For car camping and an extra bed at home, I don't see this being beat. I bought the next size down for myself and it also has held up excellent on the 50 day trip. I use a small air pad on it because I have one but have also used it by itself and find it a comfortable cot on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Northern VT

customer_reviews.title: Huge and durable
customer_reviews.text: This cot is huge. If you plan to put it in a tent, make sure your tent is huge. I made the mistake of assuming it would fit in my four-person tent, but it doesn't fit. It's my own fault for not checking dimensions. I've been sleeping on this every night for nine months, and it has easily held up to all its use. It's not extremely comfortable, but it's as comfortable as you could expect a cot to be. My own complaint is not with the cot itself, but with its carrying bag. The cot fits loosely in the bag. I was hoping it would be better than a large shopping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Rubbelke

customer_reviews.title: Man this thing is wide
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this cot, I bought it to go with the Teton tent that fits on top of it. The cot is well made but I think the end spreader bars should have been made a bit more durable. It is relatively easy to set up but once you have it put together you cannot pick up one end and move it using the spreader bar. I use a inflatable mattress pad on top of the cot and that helps the comfort level and keeps me warm during the cooler nights. Without a pad you may get a bit chilly during colder weather in just a sleeping bag. Only time will tell on how durable it is.
customer_reviews.author: James N

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: Haven't actually needed to use it yet, but will update when I do. Arrived quickly and comes in large box, because it's fully assembled, except for attaching and stretching the fabric to each end. Easy to set up, but extremely big. It really is larger then a twin sized bed. Two smaller people can actually fit on it if needed. Thought it came with a side caddy, but the storage bag attaches to the side for pockets, which is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Cot for heavyweights
customer_reviews.text: My very large (350+) son came and spent a few nights with me. Since I had converted kids bedrooms after they moved out., I bought this for him to sleep on. Honestly, I expected it to collapse under his bulk. But not only did it survive, but he told me it was really comfortable. I imagine being larger in size itself, and having a sturdy metal frame, helped.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, lasted one camping trip before it crumbled!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cot for camping. Used it once, last memorial day and it worked wonderfully. Took it out again today to use as a spare bed and it collapsed when I sat down on the end of it. the legs bent under it and now I am unable to use it for anything. I am far from the weight limit on this cot and I was really pleased with it up until today. Again, i used it one weekend for camping and had no issues with the quality or sturdiness of this cot. I will be contacting the company.
customer_reviews.author: Gerri locklear

customer_reviews.title: Ok cot.. but, repairs after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: After using this cot a 2nd time, a pin on the frame has broken loose. Most of the pins are pop riveted. The fix was pretty easy . Just looked for a similar bolt and nut. But, for the price paid and descriptions by the seller, this shouldn't be happening. Otherwise, the cot is comfortable, lays sturdy, doesn't move when you turn over and sleeps well. I gave them 4 stars just for this reason. PS : I'll just have to keep a pocket full of spare bolts...
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cot if you are looking for stability
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cot if you are looking for stability, durability, ease of set up and roominess. Fantastically comfortable. Downsides are that it is big, heavy, and clunky even when packed. It would be good to have full closure in the pack case. All of those are really non-issues if you have the room and are not trying to transport this over any distance; however if none of that matters and you are just looking for the greatest comfort then this is the cot for you.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Machamer

customer_reviews.title: You definitely need the cushion to go on top of your cut to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything it's described to be if not stronger. It is so strong that you do indeed need a cushion to go on top of it otherwise it would be too firm and eventually starts hurting. It is so strong that I slept on it for12 months every night of the week because I didn't have a bed with no complications. You must purchase the Teton cushion that goes on top of it for more comfort it is extremely strong and will not disappoint you at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bethebackwolf

customer_reviews.title: Looking Forward to Using this Cot at Summer Camp
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these cots. My son is a Boy Scout so we will be using these on campouts. Easy to set up. The last connection is a little stiff the first time but once you sleep on the cot a couple of times and the canvas stretches it is much easier to fit the last connection. Have slept on the cot for several nights and like the size. It is possible to move, turn and stretch out. Can't wait to use the cot at summer camp. Will be looking forward to a good night's sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Sunman Mom

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Carrying Bag, Flimsy Construction
customer_reviews.text: Did they really supply a carrying bag that is shorter than the crossbars so the crossbars won't fit in it? Lame. Seems quite flimsy, crossbars come off too easily when moving the cot. Mine arrived with one of the crossbar end plugs missing. I contacted TetonSports support, and they made me take pictures of the missing part (???), the whole cot, the "law tag" (whatever that is) before they would send me out a replacement 3 cent end plug. Hope this rickety thing does not fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nelson

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE these cots!!! We finally bought sleeping gear for our camping trips...these are AMAZING! my husband is 6'3" 280lbs and is extremely comfortable on this- it is the size of a twin bed- we love tenting again now that we have comfy beds!!! Definitely a little big (compared to some of the other cots) once folded down, but they are a very durable cot- easy set-up and break-down- worth every $ - we are very pleased with them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and pretty big
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. It’s kind of heavy for me (I’m 5’4”, 125#, and kinda weak) but %110 worth the effort because I had the best nights sleep ever while camping. Since it was cold, I used a Closed cell sleeping pad for insulation. I do have to take my larger tent to accommodate the cot. Lack of floor space was not an issue cuz the cot is raised enough that we stored most of our stuff under it. Watched a YouTube video on setup, and it’s as easy as advertised. Highly recommend this brand of cot
customer_reviews.author: Karen S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice cot but HUGE; bad storage bag.
customer_reviews.text: I was upgrading from a smaller, narrow cot and thought this would be nice. It is actually as big as a twin bed. My purpose for buying it was for tent camping, and I’m not sure I’ll be able to use it for that. I think it will be used for a spare bed in my house. The cot is sturdy, comfortable, easy to set up, and the lever assist is very helpful. The storage bag is a terrible design and the reason for -1 star; it’s like a giant pouch with a couple straps. A bag with a cinch top would be way better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: AS
customer_reviews.text: I like but...I am very large( hence the reason i bought this cot) and disabled so its difficult getting around...that said this thing is very large, bulky, and almost unmanageable for one person to put together....And to put it together....WOW!!~you need to be in a good workout program for a while before ordering this cot. the last end rod brings the cot to a finished piece and stretches the fabric tight and is very hard t get in the hole. once assembled though---wow, this thing is sturdy!!!...one more thing...short legged people beware!!! sitting on the side os trying for shortys!!
customer_reviews.author: TomTom

customer_reviews.title: With a camp cot you definately get what you pay for!  This one is the Best!
customer_reviews.text: This cot is so roomy and comfortable I will use it as an extra bed for company. I also purchased a 2" gel pad for it and it is simply heaven! Why buy one you can't even turn over in? This one is roomy, sturdy and easy,(once you get the hang of it) to set up. Highly recommend. Think hard on purchasing a 40 dollar piece of canvas that you will have to replace in a couple of years when you can purchase this one and it will most likely last more than your lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: M Morgensen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, amazing, amazing cot! Like taking your bed in to the wild with you. Large enough for my daughter and I to both share comfortably, if needed. This cot is sturdy and surprisingly easy to put together. The last rail can be hard to lock in if you are trying to strong arm it, but the red pivot bar works like a charm. Easy to move around by using the side rails, not the end rails. This thing is big though, so make sure of the dimensions and how much room you have in your tent. Very happy with this purchase, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Dlrp2005

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL TO ASSEMBLE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cot, mattress, tent and accessory bag and its all getting returned because the canvas it so small its impossible to assemble. All the steel bracketry has surface rust which I was willing to overlook but I’m simply not willing to wrestle with this thing every time I want to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: This cot broke after only 2 uses. My husband ...
customer_reviews.text: This cot broke after only 2 uses. My husband is a large man but definitely within the parameters of the product specificatiowins. When my husband sat up on the edge of the cot the metal bent and then broke. In addition, the bars that must be attached at each end are difficult to put on and pop off of the cot needs to be moved.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Tapio

customer_reviews.title: Holes in Canvas
customer_reviews.text: I received the XXL outfitter cot today, set up without difficulty and noticed 3 holes in the canvas, almost like it had been melted....I did send an email to Teton- so hopefully they will respond promptly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent size - easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Arrived earlier than expected. Packaged thoroughly. Appears to be well built. Easy to set up, especially with the pivot arm. Large - comfortable - plenty of room to spread out and roll from side to side (I am 6 foot 245) Cons: Scratches on the frame where the bars fit together. Sag in the canvas in the middle. This may be a returned/used item. I am hopeful that these are just minor cosmetic defects and that there will be no issues with the product. Providing a 4 star rating based on the initial overall quality and delivery. I will submit a more detailed review after the scheduled 3 night camping trip that is coming up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Definatly large and nice to have extra room for a larger sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Definatly large and nice to have extra room for a larger sleeping bag. Will not fit a queen size sleeping bag but it will hold a larger outfitter style setup no problem. I matched it with the xxl cot matress from them also and a very good buy
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: For you bigger guys!
customer_reviews.text: This cot served me extremely well. I am 6'2", 215 pounds, and am in the Air Force. I got to Iraq for a 4 months tour and immediately realized that I could not fit into the standard green cot. Not only that, I had a back surgery 7 years ago and need to be able to move around a bit. This cot took care of all my needs. It is very sturdy and light. The carrying bag works great. I purchased the TETON mat that fits this. I slept in this thing for 120 days and it doesn't seem to be sagging at all. I packed it up and brought it home with me for camping trips and guests.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, no sag no bars in your back
customer_reviews.text: Big enough for us and made sleeping outside tolerable. A bit unwieldy but once you've set up and taken down a couple times it gets easier. we purchased the XXL camping pad to use with them and are glad we did. Cot is ok, but I don't like sleeping on any cot. at least there are no bars in your back with this one. Would recommend it even without the pad but the pad helps a lot. Cot was completely reliable for getting out of and not tipping and we are big people. I'm a 2X, hubby is a 4X.
customer_reviews.author: MidwestLady

customer_reviews.title: Last bar was impossible to place.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: It held my weight con: assembling was easy until the last cross bar...I tried everything and i could not get the material to stretch enough to let me anchor it. I tried pulling in the middle, tried one end then the other, and i just could not get it to snap into place. We have two of them and we could not get the last bar on anchored on either of them.
customer_reviews.author: DCCP

customer_reviews.title: Quality portable sleep setup
customer_reviews.text: Solid cot that hasn't stretched or worn in over 6 months of daily use. I use this cot in combination with the Milliard 6-inch memory foam tri told mattress for an inexpensive 1-person sleep setup. Listed size is accurate and comfortable for myself; 5'11" at 165lbs. The measurements within the perimeter bars measure 36.5"x82". When open this cot takes up 85" long x44.75" wide x19" tall. Under storage with sag measures 37.5" between center and and legs and 15" between level floor and bottom of fabric. Labeled made in China. Excellent option for car camping or all around efficient home solution.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great cot
customer_reviews.text: Firm, stable and easy to set up. What else do you need? Well, a lighter product for starters. Also this sits too high off the ground so I'm unable to swing my feet off the cot and touch the ground to stand up. This cot needs some sort of lever for the final assembly step, and I understand that the newer version has one built in. It would be nice if they would offer this new version at a discount to those of us who purchased the older one.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Cot
customer_reviews.text: This thing is nothing short of amazing. At 6'4" and 350+ lbs, I found it to be easy to set up, sturdy and comfortable. Someone really put some thought into designing this cot. Be sure to look for and use the small red bar to get that last fitting in place. It makes all the difference between a successful and/or maddening experience. Set up and break down each in less than 5 minutes. Although I bought it a year ago and just now used it, I had several friends ask about it as they were impressed while watching me set it up and how sturdy it was. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: T.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best nights sleep I’ve ever had while camping! The cuts are sturdy and comfortable. They are very roomy, and large enough to sleep without feeling like I’m going to roll off the edge. They were a little difficult to set up the first time, but that’s because they are really tight, and you have to put some muscle in attaching the last side. I will never go back to an air mattress after trying these cots!
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Really comfie with folding cot mattress!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ... paired with a Millard trifold cit mattress; sleep like a baby. One major note of CAUTION... the end supports stick out at knee height and we all were scraping and banging our knees on them <<<ouch>>> ... slit a pool noodle and secured it around the corners with ties (not professional, but you use what you have handy when camping)... problem solved. It’s truly as comfortable as the average normal bed.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: We're going CAMPING!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. The XXL includes this little red dealio at one corner that the Universal cot does not have. It's actually pretty cool, but it took me some McGyvering to figure it out. The little dealio guides the cross bar into place, and provides leverage to snap the last cross bar into the slot. Much easier than muscling it.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality
customer_reviews.text: I am 300+ lbs and I slept on this cott every night for 2 1/2 months due to a moving situation. It lived up to all the advertising! This cot is easy to assemble, rather comfortable, very sturdy and the wider laying area gives you room to move around. The only downside is that it is rather heavy when folded up in the carrier, but the fact It held my weight without a problem is an easy tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: Randall S. Macey

customer_reviews.title: A high quality camping cot for larger people
customer_reviews.text: I love the cot. As a new scout leader I was struggling to get a good night sleep. I tried several air mattresses but nothing worked. After getting the XXL camping cot and XXL camping pad I slept almost as well as if I was in my bed at home.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use at home, along with a XXL Therm-a-Rest MondoKing mattress I use for camping. Long term, it will be a guest bed set-up, but I've been using this combination as my primary bed for a few weeks while in the middle of moving. The cot is inches wider than the mattress all around, so it felt a bit awkward for the first few days while I got used to it. Now I love it! There's room for my phone and other small items beside the mattress, which is handy, and I'm sleeping very comfortably on it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Vallentin

customer_reviews.title: Better than an Air Mattress
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and have slept on it for about 2 weeks now. A queen size fitted sheet snaps over it very nice but I am sure a twin size would work as well. Using it for an out of town remodeling job but look forward to taking it camping this winter. It is comfortable on it's own but I imagine in cold weather some type of memory foam or other insulating barrier may be beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: You will not be disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I actually tried this cot with the cushion at home for two days prior to my trip. Was like sleeping in my own bed. Used cot for a 4 day trip in a fifth wheel 36' travel trailer. So the floor was sturdy. Slept like a baby. I have a bad lower back ... and my back never gave me trouble. I am 6'-5" 235lbs. I can sleep on my back or side in this cot. Can't say enough how great this cot is.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Tener

customer_reviews.title: This cot is awesome. I am 450lbs and go camping with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This cot is awesome. I am 450lbs and go camping with the boyscouts a lot. This bed is comfortable and strong...it holds me no problem. When packed up it is large and heavy so you will not be hiking far with it. The bag also poorly accommodates the horizontal bar that the head and foot so i transport them separately. first installation is difficult because it is so tight, but once you get it in it will get easier. definitely a good buy. Some people have written that you need a pad to sleep on for comfort but i find it is just fine for a night or 2 without a pad.
customer_reviews.author: patrick charlton

customer_reviews.title: TETON Sports Outfitter XXL Camp Cot
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this cot. It is sturdy doesn't have a lot of legs but supports heavy weight. It's also WIDE so a person of girth can sleep comfortably on it. THe only thing for which I pause is, that the head and foot rail pop out of their groove if you lift the bed by the ends. One must move the cot only holding the sides. But I am amazed how well I sleep in it. I highly recommend this cot.
customer_reviews.author: C. Norton

customer_reviews.title: SO sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This cot is BIG — a standard twin sheet doesn’t fit over it. But it is quite comfortable — I added my camping mat for a little extra padding. It is firm, and doesn’t wiggle or squeak when I toss and turn. I am a 5’8”, 175 lb. woman who is a side-sleeper. Also, the $10 extra for the attachment that makes the cot easier to assemble is worth its weight in gold!
customer_reviews.author: life-long learner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was very reluctant to use these for our beds at our sons house on the Air Force base. I am happy to report they are a nice size. My husband is 6'1 210 and he had lots of room on his. We bought a nice memory foam to fit from Costco, I slept on this for 13 days and to be honest it was the best sleep I've had in years. Even better than my temper-pedic bed at home.
customer_reviews.author: DEBORAH MEAS

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This a huge cot. I used them during a military move. Super super easy to put together and take down. Unfortunately I didn’t have one of my sleeping bags, just a poncho liner. The material is very tight and none flexible thus you really need a mat or bag. I would recommend it for extra guests or to set up as a permenant bunk at a camp. Military could use them in transition areas. Also it comes with a very nice carrying case. Bottom line it is great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: YC

customer_reviews.title: So far. So good.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ridiculously big. We have two 50lb dogs, and my boyfriend is 6'7 210 and I'm 5'10 and 180. The entire family fell asleep on this thing the day I got it. It's so comfortable. I broke my tailbone and was worried about sleeping on the ground when car camping. + For it's size it breaks down really small. The only issue I have is the legs not being flush and put down properly before installing the spread bar. Just gotta remember to check it. Hopefully it holds up well camping. Hopefully this guy will hold up for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a family member when they come to visit. They've had the best sleep ever! It was big enough for them, and high enough off the ground to get on and off easy. I was able to set it up and take it down by myself, 5'2" height. Do remember not to sit directly on the frame, as that will damage the product. Just make sure you get as close as you can to the cot before sitting. So glad I got this!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Rowanwax

customer_reviews.title: Great cot, easy setup, big enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'2", 230lbs with wide shoulders. Needless to say, I need a roomy and sturdy cot. This cot gives me that. My cot is used for camping. I'm out for multi days and am too old to be lying on the ground anymore. I like a good night's sleep. This is easy and quick to set up. Down side is that its heavy and is a good sized package when folded. I would buy this cot again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: James Black

customer_reviews.title: The best for big ppl, get the pivot arm.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these with the arm and my friend got one without the arm. We got to the campsite and I slapped mine together and he didn't have a tool to put the last notch on. He had to go find a crow bar. My bed was at a slight slope downward so my sleeping bag kept sliding down but it wasn’t too bad. I had some back pain at the start of the trip and the stiff cot actually helped to improve it. My bed must be too soft. If your a big person this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: review

customer_reviews.title: Huge cot, well made
customer_reviews.text: I finally gave up on air mattresses when traveling to friends houses and find this to be great replacement. I also greatly appreciate that the length is so long as I am used to having to sleep weird to keep my feet from going over the side. It's also quite wide so there is plenty of room to stretch out for sleep. Sleeps pretty well as top off for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T Wills

customer_reviews.title: Great - love it!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a wide bottom, this is the camping cot for you! You will NOT fall off. Also, if you are tall this is also the camping cot for you. Excellent, quality materials. I love it, EXCEPT as a weak short lady and it's almost as long as I am tall, and really heavy. That's when it pays to play helpless female.
customer_reviews.author: princesspoodle

customer_reviews.title: Set up really stinks!
customer_reviews.text: I found this really difficult to put together. I could never put on D so I am going to send it back because I would not want to have to do this not even once. I had to give it ones because I couldnt get it together.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cot for a recent camping trip. I’m a big gal, so I needed something sturdy and this cot did not disappoint. It’s plenty wide enough and was very comfy when topped with a 2” memory foam pad. Set up was pretty easy, although getting the last corner of the story bar in place was tricky. Taking it down was much easier. My only problem is that now I need a bigger tent!
customer_reviews.author: Sparty Girl

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty. Maybe too heavy for some.
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness of this cot. It is also easy to set up once you do it once. You may need to watch the video to get it right because of one little feature that is very simple once you do it but not intuitive if you don't have the instructions or are just not reading them. This cot is rated for like 600 pounds! They also make a tent that fits right on top of it and you could sleep two in that. Very clever, sturdy and firm as a bed.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell

customer_reviews.title: My perfect camping companion
customer_reviews.text: I do long term (1-3 weeks) tent camping (you can see the cot in my tent in the picture above) in a canvas tent and I bring this cot with me every time. I bought it in Feb 2018 and used it all summer, over a period of 5 months. It has held up so well and is still in great shape. I set it up as a 'guest bed' periodically if I have someone stay over and all of my friend have slept on it comfortably. I'm 250 I lbs and 6" tall and sleep great on it. My camping season starts again in February and you can bet that will be going on my trip with me.
customer_reviews.author: Rainey

customer_reviews.title: Fer' Sleepin Outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice size cot and is fairly comfortable to sleep in, it beats sleepin on the floor of the tent. It beats airing up an air up mattress just to let it go flat in the middle of the night. It is a little hard to get setup but its sturdy when it is setup. I wish I would have got the one with the little red bar that helps in setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy the Dog

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light
customer_reviews.text: It’s a solid cot. Easy to assemble and store, maybe I’m just a wuss but I didn’t sleep great on this thing. Tossing and turning. But could be just me. It is fairly compact for how sturdy it is but it’s car camping cot only. Don’t try to hike with it. It’s fairly light. Easy to set up and very strong I weigh 225 and 6’1” and had a good fit I think.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great durable cot for this fat-bottomed girl!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a small woman. I am tall and 200+ pounds. This cot is very sturdy, I have no fears of it collapsing. Comes with a great carrying bag that you can sling over your shoulder. Yes it is a tad heavy, but like I said I am not a small woman. For right now, I am not using the pricey pad that can be purchased separately. A friend has the pad and it is very comfortable and I will be getting this, but for now I am just using a fat comforter as padding.
customer_reviews.author: Bev from Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: My husband leaves for Idaho in two weeks and I ordered him one of these ....it was never delivered even though it says it was.. So I disputed the order but no response yet. I then ordered it again because he NEEDS somewhere to sleep. Got it today and the bar on the side where the material wraps is completely bent. This item is not usable. I want to give a good review but sadly cant. The size looks great if we could use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Large heavy duty cot but I'm disappointed! The metal end bars snap over a PLASTIC piece. Why plastic on a very expensive cot? The end bars are nearly impossible to stretch over the connecting piece and as soon as I get them in place, they pop off. The cheap plastic piece is not going to survive this. It will end up getting sheared off.
customer_reviews.author: Granny2

customer_reviews.title: Padding is definitely needed for comfort but great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: The extra width is great especially if you're use to moving when sleeping. Would like it more if cot was elevated on one side for head so extra pillows are not needed. Extra padding is highly suggested to be purchased. The bed is easy to assemble until you try to put last crossbar in place & lock it into position for 1st time. I had to use a prybar I had around to create necessary levarage to pop last corner into position. This probably will get easier as fabric stretches from use. Any substantial branch or tool handle would most likely work in place of prybar.
customer_reviews.author: Tally

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD... HOWEVER THE BAG IS HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the carry bag is horrible, and since this thing is big and awkward, and meant to be carried with you, more thought to the carrying device wouldve been nice. It's definitely comfortable, and seems well built. The pivot arm is necessary... You cannot assemble it without it... However a short broom handle is all that's required.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Large cot, easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good size cot and it was easy to put together in about 10-12 minutes. We don't do a lot of camping, but we have guests and this is working great for our company that stays overnight. We also use a foam mattress on the top and everyone is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RayD

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this is a recent addition or not, but this cot now has a little red piece to make set up a breeze. Just make sure when installing the bars on the end that the two pieces with red are together. Install that corner last and it is super easy. I have seen reviews about how hard the last corner can be. Teton Sports has addressed that issue with excellence. Congrats to whoever came up with the little red piece. You fixed the problem the plagues all quality cots.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Would have been great if I could’ve used it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch of Teton products for camping and have been very disappointed so far. The pivot arm was broken and there was dirt on the foot pads like it was used already It was packed tight in the box and still had all the tags though so I’m not sure. I’m not sure If i should even use it now.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C.

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality cot
customer_reviews.text: Super high quality cot. Slept on it for the first time last night with the available pad. Super comfortable and super easy to assemble. It comes with a built in red bar to alleviate the issues of getting the bars connected when tight. I put it up in less than 45 seconds. Ordering a second one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for side sleepers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable & Sturdy!!! I ordered two (New) at the same time and both arrived in the same shipment. One of them arrived with the red pivot arm slightly bent and I bent it back into functional shape. You can order replacement parts from Teton I ordered (4)more red pivot arms just incase my own storage or usage bends or breaks another pivot arm.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy well constructed ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the BIGGEST cot I have ever seen. What I like the most is the ease of use and simple yet strong construction. It is as big as a twin bed. There is a sleeping tent available that is built with the bed the base and an awning over the top . It would take a four person dome to actually cover one of these. The size is... intimidating when one thinks 'cot'. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Koller

customer_reviews.title: It's so sturdy! The only drawback is that it's wide
customer_reviews.text: When my husband sat on the edge of his extra large coleman cot and the fabric tore through, I knew I had to find something special. Well, this cot is a monster! It's so sturdy! The only drawback is that it's wide, so four cots do not fit in our six-person tent! Even still, my husband and son snuggle on the one cot - it's that big. It is a little tricky putting together - requires a bit of strength. By the way, my husband isn't that large - he weighed under the weight limit for the coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie G. Phillips-catton

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product! I'm 6'7" and 350 lbs. On a 4 night camping trip recently I was really glad to have this. Even with my larger size, it held up quite well. The materials used are durable and made to last. It takes a little muscle and/or logical thinking when it comes to leverage to get the last slot assembled, which I don't consider a bad thing (hence the 5 stars). I would (and probably will) recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: stream

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Originally bought an air mattress while I wait for my bed to be delivered after a move thinking I could use it for guests later but it didn’t last. Decided not to risk another one and got this instead. Sturdy and comfortable! I’ve been sleeping on it for a few weeks and recommend a foam topper if it’s used for more than a few days. But definitely ok without.
customer_reviews.author: 5pyGirl

customer_reviews.title: It's big and heavy but it is a great cot.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a cot that fits me comfortably. Use a piece of rebar to pry the last bar into the slot, as with most cots of this type it is too taught to try using your arms. I'm a big boy and it works better than anything else out there as far as I can tell. I bought a 2 inch memory foam pad and a thrift store twin fitted sheet to cover the top.
customer_reviews.author: Sapian

product_meta.title: TETON Sports Outfitter XXL Camping Cot; Camping Cots for Adults; Folding Cot Bed; Easy Set Up; Storage Bag Included
product_meta.description: Take the comfort of a bed to the outdoors when you choose the TETON Sports Outfitter XXL Camp Cot. This portable sleep system means you’re free from dealing with rocks and other uneven surfaces while trying to sleep. And you deserve a good night’s sleep when you’re camping so you can wake up refreshed and ready for the day’s adventures. For a cot setup that seems like child’s play, choose the "Outfitter With Pivot Arm" in the selector box. Its patented pivot arm is a built-in lever that makes putting the last end bar into place quick and easy. It does all the work for you so the fourth corner is as easy as the first. Remember to choose the pivot arm cot for this great feature! Both cots are equal in quality and larger than a twin mattress! Made with a 600D Oxford canvas bed and patented steel S-leg assembly can hold up to 600 pounds (272 kg). Add the TETON Sports Outfitter XXL Camp Pad to your purchase for a 5-star camping experience.
feature_bullets: PIVOT ARM REVOLUTION: Cot setup just became child’s play; The pivot arm is a built-in lever that makes putting that last end bar in place quick and easy; No more wrestling with that fourth corner; Look for "Outfitter With Pivot Arm" in the selector box
STRONG AND STURDY: Reinforced steel S-leg assembly strengthens the cot and provides stability; Portable folding cot makes camp set up hassle free

GET OFF THE GROUND: Take the comfort of a bed to the outdoors; Sleep free from rocks and other unlevel surfaces when you use this TETON Sports Cot; You deserve a good night’s sleep when you’re camping; Wake up refreshed
SIZE DOES MATTER: Larger than a twin bed and supports up to 600 pounds (272 kg) easily; Cot folds down for easy transport; Pack weight 26 pounds (11.8 kg)
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
